website_summaries.verdict: This loose powder has been around since 1935 and comes in two translucent options. It has gained a loyal customer base from decades of consistent wear.
pros: Produces a soft finish that absorbs oil and locks other makeup products in place
Brand has longevity – many wearers remember their mothers or grandmothers wearing it
Plus, you get a lot of product for the price
cons: The downside of its oil-absorbing action is that it can be drying

customer_reviews.title: I love this loose powder out of all the ones I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this loose powder out of all the ones I've tried and it smells amazing! No flash back and it blends very well!
customer_reviews.author: cici cway

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: toxic ingredients!
customer_reviews.text: Did not know this had talc in it as the main ingredient. Talc is scientifically proven to be toxic and harmful. Especially when inhaled, it can cause lung cancer. Please do yourself a favor and DON'T BUY THIS. If you don't believe me, do your own research.
customer_reviews.author: MeowAlicia

customer_reviews.title: LAURA MERCIER DUPE
customer_reviews.text: its perfect!!! It comes with so much product, and the puff it comes with is pretty handy. the application is smooth and is great for baking. My makeup came out flawless. I set my makeup with this and worked out right after. THERE WAS NO SEPERATION, NO CREASING. This powder blessed me. GOD BLESS.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended by a friend about this product. And so as to see them on youtube tutorials. It really helps to keep the makeup flawless and not get cakey. I love it! Enough to last quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: llArii

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely OBSESSED!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally blown away by this product! I have been consistently using Laura Mercier's Translucent Loose Setting Powder for about 6 months, and was dissatisfied with the fact that my skin appeared greasy/oily by the end of the work day. By 5PM, I have been wearing my makeup for about 10 hours. I also live in a warm climate and have oily skin. By the end of my work day using this powder, my face is still very matte! I am THRILLED! This way outperforms the Laura Mercier powder and is 13% of the cost. Can't believe it. Never going back.
customer_reviews.author: AlexisJulian

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: CONTAINS CANCER CAUSING ASBESTOS
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 2 of these I discovered that the talc powder used in this specific product contains 8-20% asbestos which can cause rare abdominal and chest cancers etc! Works fine but use at your own risk! There's a reason this is so inexpensive! I tried to return, but this product does not qualify for returns!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for oily skin!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this powder. I've used more expensive ones in the past but this one takes the cake. It keeps my makeup on all day, even with my oily skin. I personally don't use the "baking" method, but even so it keeps my face in place all day, even when I get hot and sweaty. Other reviewers are right, it does have an old lady/baby powder smell, but it doesn't bother my very much and once you've applied it to your face the smell disappears. I recommend it to all of my friends! Note: all photos were taken 3-4 hours after makeup application
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Ghosts of grandmas past
customer_reviews.text: Grandma? Grandma, is that you? This sure smells like you, and it definitely makes me look like you because it accentuates every hair and pore and flake and wrinkle on my face. (No offense of course, Grandma, because you're beautiful, but I haven't quite reached your age yet and would rather not smell like Jean Nate and have every bit of makeup accentuating every skin imperfection I have.)
customer_reviews.author: smurph017

customer_reviews.title: This is the best! I learned about the product by watching some ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! I learned about the product by watching some tutorials and seen how great it worked with them. I use this powder to bake under my eyes. I posted a picture and my black circles(which are super dark) are almost completely covered. The smell isn't as bad as others have commented. Although I have been told it's cheaper at Walmart, etc. This product will definitely stay in my routine though, but will be buying from Walmart where it's a few bucks less.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This has such good reviews I thought it would be different
customer_reviews.text: This makes my makeup look cakey, dries my face out, and makes my face itch uncontrollably because of how dry it is. This has such good reviews I thought it would be different. No, it's just a talcum based loose powder. Does not justify the price at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Old lady smell and acne breakout!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to smell like an old lady and have your makeup not last longer than 45 min, buy this! I can’t believe all the Instagram girls promoting this crap!! Do yourself a favor and buy a legit face powder... this isn’t worth it. Also, made my fave break out.
customer_reviews.author: Solange L

customer_reviews.title: Smells like my grandma. ❤❤❤
customer_reviews.text: So i remember this always sitting on my great grandmas vanity right next to her bright red lipstick. So it brought back great memories. However upon opening it, it was all over the place. The plastic piece thats supose to keep it in was gone. So thats suspect.
customer_reviews.author: sheena

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this as a light dusting powder to get rid of shine over makeup. I have no problem with caking or creasing when using this one. As a veteran makeup artist I have tried many different powders over the years and always come back to this one. Sometimes it's hard to find in stores, but the company has been around for many, many years. I would recommend this to anyone who needs or likes to use a face powder over a little foundation or using a BB cream. The Naturally Neutral is for fair skinned ladies, and it works well if you need to dust over light concealer (if you have dark circles under your eyes), or blemishes.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Used?
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with the seal broken. I think it might have been used. I'm traveling tomorrow and unfortunately cannot return or reorder. Disappointed as my money has gone to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Biryani

customer_reviews.title: Very nice finish.
customer_reviews.text: I got both the translucent and the translucent extra coverage but I would suggest just getting one or the other because I didn't see much of a difference except the extra coverage might be a half a shade darker/tinted. Over all I love the finish this powder gave to my skin. It sets your makeup and doesn't over mattify your skin. The FRAGRANCE is very strong but I'm not offended by it too much but I think the one without fragrance might be a good option. I would say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: kellie

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Powder-- ever.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this powder so much. I've tried various brands of loose powder and wasn't expecting anything out of the ordinary with this product. BUT, this powder smells nicer than any other brand of makeup I've tried. The one I ordered is full coverage, translucent and I love that I don't have to wear concealer all of the time. This powder is one of my favorite parts of my make up routine and I will continue to buy it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna L

customer_reviews.title: Very strong smell, returned
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because the perfumey smell of the powder was overwhelming. I was sneezing all day after putting this on in the morning. After some googling, I discovered that there is an unscented version of this powder, but really disappointed that Amazon doesn’t carry the unscented powder.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Cstmr

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of makeup tutorials and girls used and compared this product. I usually use mercier and this setting powder worked just as well. I'm a darker tan complexion and it went will with my skin tone.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Flawless finish !
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't wear powder but this one I thought I would try and it's great ! I out a little on after my primer and makeup and over my lipstick , it doesn't settle in lines and keeps my lipstick on longer ! The smell to me is a Rosey like smell but it goes away . This powder is great for my light skin tone and it does leave a nice flawless look.!
customer_reviews.author: georgiapeach

customer_reviews.title: Toxic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in an insomnia induced shopping spree. It has so many positive reviews I didnt think that many people could be completely oblivious to the chemicals they are putting on their skin. Its my fault really for not checking the ingredients first. But, the second I opened this product I could tell it was toxic. The overwhelming perfume sent of baby powder, the talc. I really dont understand how anyone can comfortably put this on their face each day. Im glad it was cheap because it went straight in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: Would not repurchase
customer_reviews.text: The inside plastic piece with the holes is warped just like many other people have stated in their reviews. It's super messy to work with because none of the powder comes out of the warped piece. The smell is very strong, some people like it, some people don't. I have the covergirl loose powder and the elf translucent powders to compare this to and I prefer those two over this one any day.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, great smell
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is not a bad product, even for people of color contrary to what some have said. I am African American+Latino with a warm tan skin tone and the finished look was pretty good. That said, I've used better translucent powders, especially considering this isn't completely translucent; it has a slight tent of pigment to it that does alter the colour of my makeup, but not to such a problem that I would throw the product out. Also the smell is awesome, it's like a refreshing sweet smell that lasts surprisingly long after you apply it, it gets bonus points for that in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Salif

customer_reviews.title: Clean scent, affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I do my makeup everyday for work and I love reaching for this. Airspun is an affordable and great product. The scent is one of my favorite things. It smells like fresh laundry but doesnt linger all day. Its light and with a fluffy brush it does on easily enough to make sure my foundation doesnt start to melt off in the summer heat. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dagmar Mercado

customer_reviews.title: How can people like this?
customer_reviews.text: How does this have so many stars by so many people?! Cheaply made, it feels grainy to me. Plus the slight tint gives my very fair complexion a weird color. And it has a strong smell that reminds me of a powder my grandma used on herself growing up. I use Makeup Forever HD translucent powder and definitely won’t be switching. This goes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jessup

customer_reviews.title: overpowering scent, looks dry on skin
customer_reviews.text: have to be careful when applying under by eyes bc it can make them look dry sometimes. Also the odor is extreme but it smells like baby powder so it's not horrible. Lots of product for the price so this will last me a very long time. Update: ended up tossing this because the scent was getting way overpowering. It didn't control my oils at all and actually made me look really dry which doesn't happen with any other powders I've tried. Also I think it broke me out because of the fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: Alexiya

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: If I would have known about this product sooner I would have been so much happier with the way powder performed on my oily skin. This is the perfect powder for baking, a light layer of setting powder, you name it. I have both high end and drug store foundations and concealers and it makes both look flawless. Best of all it keeps my oily skin at bay ALL DAY (say goodbye to blotting sheets and powders). As far as the scent goes, it is a little baby powder like, but I do not think it lingers for very long (maybe 10 minutes tops). Doesnt bother me however I am not that sensitive to scents.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Very fine affordable powder with different uses.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very, very fine powder that I put over SPF50 suntan lotion on my deccolage because the lotion makes me look greasy and shiny and I don't like it. I also use this over IT cosmetics SPF50 BB cream to take down the shine. I sometimes use it on my eyelids before applying eyeshadow to assist with application. It doesn't irritate my skin and I can apply an extremely light application or use a sponge to dab it on my T zone for oil control. I really like this powder and it's less expensive than others.
customer_reviews.author: Melner

customer_reviews.title: I Have Come Full Circle
customer_reviews.text: Growing up this was about all we had. I’m old. I couldn’t wait to try new ones in my 20’s! I thought grandmas old powder was behind the times. Well now I’m in my 50’s and I’m back. Obviously I am a slow learner. Coty was years ahead of its time. The best setting powder out there.
customer_reviews.author: ASConner

customer_reviews.title: CAUSES BREAKOUTS
customer_reviews.text: I have had completely clear skin for a couple of months FINALLY and within 2 days of using this product I had 4 pimples exactly where I applied it on my forehead and chin. Very deep, cystic pimples like I had never gotten before. Will be throwing this out. Must be the scent irritating my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Banks

customer_reviews.title: A must have product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best powder out there and the price is amazing. There is a reason it’s been out since 1935! It will make your makeup look so much better and it doesn’t feel heavy. Some people don’t like the fragrance but I do. Reminds me of a very classic scent, almost like a memory from childhood. It comes with a big powder puff which I do actually use sometimes as well as with my beauty blender. Definitely give this a try! I use the translucent.
customer_reviews.author: Vintagedoll

customer_reviews.title: Gag-Inducing smells ruins a probably otherwise decent product
customer_reviews.text: With so many great reviews, I wanted to give this a try. Unfortunately, between the talc content and the added fragrance, this smelled like that fake makeup they make for kids. The smell was so strong that I could still smell it 10 minutes after putting it in my face, and I had to wash it off because I couldn't stand it. I put it on a bare face, and I'd seemed to have a decent mattifying effect, but I can't wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoneer

customer_reviews.title: It’s a love-hate relationship...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and how soft it makes my skin feel. It’s extremely light weight, and it’s such a fine powder that you really get that soft look when you don’t feel like dealing with putting on a full face of makeup. Now let’s talk about the scent....WOAH! Too much. It smells kind of like that “old lady” perfume, and it’s extremely strong. It does linger, but not for long. Second, it makes a MESS! Have fun applying, but get ready to have loose powder everywhere with this stuff. I love it for just basic everyday wear and as setting powder though. I’d buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Product very cheap and has a horrible smell to it! My item also arrived partially open. Will never order again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Park

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful finishing powder for a great look
customer_reviews.text: I wear all kinds of makeup I wear professional stage makeup I wear expensive makeup I wear cheap makeup overall this powder is the best that I found in years it has enough coverage to smooth out imperfections it smells extremely nice without being overpowering a creates a very nice finish especially over makeup such as flawless finish or pan stick it doesn't cake it does what makeup supposed to do and hamsters the original product there's nothing bad I can say about this powder the price is good the packaging is wonderful it comes in many different shades not only translucent but translucent extra coverage I have a large puff I put it everywhere my skin looks excellent
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Coty Airspun
customer_reviews.text: I picked up two jars of this classic staple, Naturally Neutral and Translucent. Both work well on my light skin tone. I like the finish of this after using, and can see why it's highly rated. Good coverage, lots of powder for the price. I'm off put by the scent, it's classic Noxzema, which comes across as powdery old lady in this powder form. When I use this, I find I stay matte all day - however, it creases. It just settles into my lines, and needs to be smoothed out a few times during my work day. It's nice to have on hand, but it's not my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Melaina Lara

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product came halfway wrapped and half spilled. Once I managed to open the powder it exploded all over me. Now I may be able to deal with the smell if it hadn’t been all over me. Would probably love it if the powder had been secured during shipping and I would have been able to open it like any other powder I’ve ever tried. So disappointed since it seems to work for everyone else. Don’t know if mine had previously been opened or if that’s how it comes.
customer_reviews.author: robin bansemer

customer_reviews.title: I like this powder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this powder to use mainly as a setting powder to keep my foundation going throughout the day. Admittedly, I'd been spoiled after using the Laura Mercier translucent powder for years, however, I wanted to find a similar product that wouldn't break the bank. I like this powder. It is very soft and finely milled. Easy to apply and doesn't look cakey. It is surprisingly quite fragrant -- reminds me of a baby powder scent, which I could do without. It also has a very slight whitefish color to it that can be visible if not blended in nicely. Overall, it is a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Dentist_chickTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: ... african american in a lighter tone and It looks fine without looking too ashy
customer_reviews.text: I am african american in a lighter tone and It looks fine without looking too ashy, especially after blending with my contour. I don't bake with it I just dust it on and dust it off. I've also used it on some of my darker friends and it looks fine. I'd continue to buy this as a cheap alternative. The only thing that's annoying about it is that it gets everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm an Airspunner for life!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so silky soft. It kinda has a baby powder smell to it but it's not over powering like some people are saying. I like the smell actually and it only lasts a few minutes while applying. The price for the amount you get is awesome. It smoothed my uneven toned textured skin out and that's really hard to do. I'm have really bad oily skin after a few hours and this definitely minimized it, if you reapply threw out the day (I work 13-15hr days 6days a week), it doesnt look cakey at all. I'm an Airspunner for life now!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ksmith

customer_reviews.title: Okay - WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I used to sell makeup and have never used a translucent powder to set my makeup or for any other reason, even though I was telling my customers they needed it. (wow) After reading the reviews and seeing this is an "old school" product, I decided to break down and give it a try. I love it I love everything about it. The scent, the way it makes everything "stay put" (eye brow pencil even!) and love that it's so translucent no one knows it's there. In a nutshell, I'm pleasantly surprised and pleased "to the max"! I highly recommend this to anyone who has never used a translucent powder before.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia June

customer_reviews.title: A Beauty Classic Still Relevant in the Beauty Community
customer_reviews.text: My go to for baking and setting my makeup along with spritzing my face to finish the look, the setting lasts ALL day. Highly recommend. A bit perfumey but I'm an old fashioned gal and find it rather old timey and delicious. If you are allergic to scents, there is an unscented one which I hear is hard to find but does exist. This one has some color to it but it matches me so I'm not worried about it, works fine. There is a transparent version as well. A beauty classic.
customer_reviews.author: a fellow seer

customer_reviews.title: Get shade darker than normal
customer_reviews.text: It's very perfume-y. Use sparingly and don't breath in while applying. Went right up my nose. Looks darker than it really is. Color I got is Honey Beige. I have light skin but this is still too light for me. It was an impulse purchase due to nostalgia. My mother used to keep this in bathroom on sink or in medicine cabinet over 30 years ago. Texture is very smooth and velvety. Just like I remembered. Coverage is good. Very good quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly Bear

customer_reviews.title: Coty needs to make a fragrance free version of this.
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews that commented on the powerful scent but I thought, how bad could it be. Answer is - overwhelming. I can’t bear it. It really is a old lady small. I put some in a jar and left it outside in the sun all day, hoping it would get rid of the strong perfumed smell but I don’t think it diminished at all. There’s no way I can use this, the smell actually makes me feel nauseous. I’m glad it wasn’t expensive.
customer_reviews.author: sm77

customer_reviews.title: Why is this so highly rated?
customer_reviews.text: I'm a borderline hoarder and I still threw mine away. I tried a dozen times to get this to work right and it just doesn't. It made my Sephora foundation really gross and cakey. It looked like it was breaking down my foundation. I also tried it on my skin, no foundation. The only way I can see someone using this is a very very very light amount on super oily areas. Also, the container is crap, way too much product dumps out and won't settle back in. And it smells bad. If you're looking for something really cheap that works well just get an Elf contour palette, that stuff is great.
customer_reviews.author: Koshka

customer_reviews.title: Love the Suntan shade
customer_reviews.text: I have oily skin... Thank Gawd. This is the only powder that will keep the shine down for longer than 5 hours. I originally bought the translucent powder but wanted a shade closer to my skin tone. The Suntan shade is a really good alternative. I still use the original, but use the Suntan shade daily for my conservative office job to keep the highlight appearance to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the kind of person that buys top line makeup products unless it’s foundation. All the extras I don’t spend money on so I can’t compare it to it’s expensive counterpart. I have sensitive skin and this felt very light on top of my foundation and blended wonderfully. Also had ZERO transfer, not just on clothes but on my cellphone! Zero makeup transferred to my phone screen when I talked on the phone. I also was wearing a new foundation which does claim to be transfer resistant (too faced peach perfection foundation) but the fact that this powder didn’t transfer at all as well was wonderful. Glad I found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great price- but strong, unpleasant smell!
customer_reviews.text: If you hate products that are HEAVILY scented, you’ve gotta skip this! I’m sure this could be a great powder for some. But I didn’t even taken off the plastic seal and I already had a headache within seconds of just opening the lid (from the musky smell!!). I couldn’t imagine wearing this on my face all day. 2 stars because it’s only $3, but the ingredients are not great. With talc being the main ingredient, and this being a loose powder that you apply to your face, it’s quite easy to accidentally inhale it. Depending on how much talc is really in it- it can be bad for you, especially with repetitive use over time!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha V

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to be a powdery old lady? Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: You can literally smell the talc in this. While it does a decent job setting your makeup, even a small amount made me look powdery and about 10 years older. It also smells horrendously of “old lady” powder and the smell never dissipates. Though my skin is sensitive, it didn’t break me out. I gave it one star for the low price and the good amount of product, as they do give you a lot (probably due to how cheap quality the powder is). I’d recommend spending a little more on a quality powder that won’t age you or break you out if you have sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not good for oily skin or to set liquid foundation
customer_reviews.text: I bought the translucent shade and it was so cakey. I have oily skin, and use an oil free liquid foundation. It never really set my foundation, it just felt like it sat on the skin. Once my face developed some shine over the course of the day (which was quicker than usual with this powder) it looked cakey EVERYWHERE including the nose area, around my mouth and in between my eyebrows. I tried it twice using a brush and a beauty blender and using a lot versus a little product. It just didn’t work for me. If you have oily skin, and possibly use the Maybelliene Better Skin foundation, I wouldn’t choose this powder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Translucent setting powder
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner in makeup and have always heard beauty influencers mention this product so for the price I took a chance and I’m glad I did. I have very oily skin and this product doesn’t give me dry patches like the elf make me matte powder. It smells good not a strong scent at all. I use it to set my eyebrows and they last all day! The only thing.....it’s not a screw on cap so if it falls if will definitely make a mess. I have kids and I’m very careful but that’s just me. Other than that definitely recommend it and and I will be stacking them up.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Reeks, burns, mostly Talc
customer_reviews.text: This product has a very strong baby powder fragrance that does not dissipate after application. My skin burned a bit for a few minutes after application as well. The first ingredient is talc, which is not healthy to breathe. It does work to mattify and blur the face, however. All in all I do not feel this is a healthy product to use and the fragrance is nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well...but the scent is a bit too strong...especially if you need to wear a face mask.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have any experience using face powder, but I wanted to try this out based on the excellent reviews. I think it works pretty good for setting my makeup (as far as I can tell). The only complaint I have is the scent. It has a pretty strong baby powder scent. I figured that the scent would dissipate after wearing it for a few minutes, but it does not. And then, if you are needing to put on a face mask while wearing this powder, it traps the strong scent in. Face masks are uncomfortable enough to wear...this face powder makes face masks even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A.

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: I used to use just the Laura Mercier and bought this on recommendation. There is so much product. I do not recommend the translucent if you are beyond medium complexion. It leaves me light in the areas I apply. Even after setting spray. It does smell a little “old lady-ish” but my setting spray takes care of that. Also the lid doesn’t twist on it slide on and off making it a little dangerous. I plan on buy a small locking tupperware type container for it instead.
customer_reviews.author: SexyTrash

customer_reviews.title: Let me tell you this powder smells amazing and it's very light
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you this powder smells amazing and it's very light! The reason I started using it is because I saw the famous Patrick star use it and his face always looks amazing right after! It's great for people with oily skin, I use it to bake my face when I contour it works to clean up the contour plus it adds a little highlight! You won't regret buying this I promise
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product based on the amazing reviews and the insanely tempting price. I have fair skin so thought I can't go wrong with a halfway decent translucent powder. I really do not like this product, it looks like someone threw talcum powder on my face when I use, it gives a very washed out/covered in a layer of powder look - even though I use professional brushes and really try to lightly press it into my under eye area. It smells like some powder my mom used in the '90s and I do not mean that in a good way... As well, it gathers in the creases under my eyes despite using an eye cream, primer, and foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted to try this product and finally was able to! When it arrived, I was a disappointed though... the inside lid that releases the powder through the holes was completely smashed and distorted and a bunch of powder fell out all over when I opened the lid... other than that... it’s a great product! The smell is okay not amazing but not overly strong. I love the way my skin looks and now feel I may never use foundation powder again!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Hemsath

customer_reviews.title: Makes me itchy!
customer_reviews.text: I wish the products I used in my 20's stayed the same. Or maybe it's my skin that changed? Whatever it is, this doesn't do the same job as it did back then. It literally feels scratchy going on. Only thing that is the same is the look of the container and the scent of the powder. The scent, I LOVE. Reminds me of my mom. That's why I'm giving it 3 stars. otherwise it would be 2. A friend told me to buy one from the store and try it because the formula is different online. That doesn't make sense so I'm not going to bother wasting more money on it.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Packaging doesn't close properly, but product is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Read some mixed reviews about this setting powder, but the good ones made me want to try it! I noticed that it felt really good on my face, the scent is not unbearable and it keeps my oily zones under control during the day. My only one complaint is the way the container is designed, it does not close properly and it could spill very easily (even when you close it well) inside of your make up bag.. I just keep mine in a small zip lock bag and haven't had any issues after that! The price and the quality of the powder itself are amazing! I will keep buying this every time I run out!
customer_reviews.author: Odra

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, customer for life now!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and smells wonderful! Has a sweet scent that doesnt bug me. Normally powders smell like chemicals if they have any fragrance to them. Not this product. Works very well and if you use it correctly to bake it does not look at all cakey. Very natural and stays on all day for the most part and I don't use a setting spray. Love this item, buy it you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Manning

customer_reviews.title: The Old Faithful of face powders!
customer_reviews.text: This is the old faithful of powders. I have tried others over the years and yet I go back to my Grand nuggets Mother's powder. This stuff is fantastic for baking concealer and for all over color. It covers well, sets beautifully and stays nice even in the FL heat and I love the smell and even though I have very fair sensitive skin, it has never irritated me. Oh and the price is awesome 2 for $6.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for product and amount!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product because it’s so versatile. I mainly use it as a setting powder, but I also use it as an alternative to dry shampoo. It smells good and doesn’t break me out (most products do, at least at first!). I highly recommend for anyone that wants their makeup to last a long time! I tap product into the lid and use the poof that it comes with to press powder into my t zone. Then I use a big fluffy brush to sweep off the excess. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I can always trust in my Coty Airspun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a classic powder. It's as good as any high end face powder, if not better. That's why it has been around for so many years. I have large pores and fine lines. This powder gives a flawless appearance without any flashback. I personally love the fragrance, but there is a non-fragranced option also. I will always repurchase this and have it in my collection. I know I can always rely on it. It's so affordable too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for those with Talc allergies
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely allergic to Talc and had to give this away. Not great for those with Talc allergies!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: annajean

customer_reviews.title: My favorite setting powder!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of setting powders. From Maybelline, to Laura Mercier, to Tarte and Elf. High end to Drugstore. and I absolutely love this product, I don’t see myself spending money on any other setting powder. I told my friend I was tired of paying $60 for my Laura Mercier powder that only lasted a few months and she recommended this. It’s so affordable and works BETTER than the more expensive ones I’ve tried. and it lasts a long time! I’ve been using this for 2 months and still have LOTS of product left! I either use it to bake or set my face with a beauty blender. I recommend this to everyone now.
customer_reviews.author: ellie

customer_reviews.title: An afforable dupe to some of your favorite high end powders.
customer_reviews.text: I like this loose powder. It works for baking as well as a finishing powder. It doesn't cake up or leave a white cast. It works just as well and even better than the higher emd products I've used in the past. My only complaint is that the container does not close, so I am always worried that I will knock it over, make a huge mess, and lose tons of product. If they changed/updated the packaging, it would get 5 starts from me. In the meantime, I am seeking a container that I can close so I can transfer this product into it.
customer_reviews.author: Sanriobaby

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN EXPENSIVE BRANDS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried MANY loose powders and this is the best ever!!! It blurs pores. It is truly colorless. And VERY LONG WEARING! I wear glasses and the bottom of the frames rub on my cheeks and lift my makeup. This foundation has stood up against that better than any other powder, including ones that are $45!!! Extremely long wear. Havent had any problems with sweating it off either. There is a strong smell of vanilla but I dont mind and it seems to go away after application and doesnt stay smelling long.
customer_reviews.author: sadie marie

customer_reviews.title: looked Cakey and didnt work at all
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product because I have been seriously looking for a cheaper option to the Tarte amazonian clay setting powder, but this will not be it. I use bare minerals liquid foundation and fenty concealer then used this to set it and the results were horrible. Everything looked creased and cakey. worst of all, I went to blot my nose in the morning and this along with all the makeup that I had under it leaving my face looking blotchy and uneven. I hate this stuff and ended up just throwing it in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's not great but it's not horrible. It does have a smell to it that reminds me of an elderly woman's perfume, which isn't something I really wanted. However, that goes away after a bit or is masked by whatever else you might put on. If you have dry skin, do not use. It brings out every inch of your dry skin and is not a great look. It is also super easy to spill due to the lid not being a twist on. If you drop it, the lid will be coming off and you will have a mess on your hands. Yet it does get the job done so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous setting powder
customer_reviews.text: I'm 51 years old, and I've been using Airspun powder since I was in my twenties. I've tried other powders, but I always come back to Airspun because it's always been superior to anything else I've tried. It has a soft, fine texture that applies so smoothly. It sets your makeup fabulously, and helps to minimize pores. It's also great for baking. I love the iconic Airspun scent. Try it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Deck

customer_reviews.title: Works great, smell is just ok
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a product to reduce creasing with my makeup, and this 98% works for me! I say 98% because this is my first time ever using a translucent powder, so there is still a little trial and error in application and such (operator error?). I used the baking technique and was very pleased with the results. The lines are still visible, but they aren't exaggerated anymore. I'm hoping that the lines will be even less visible as my personal technique improves! I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Fearn

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and at a Great Price Point!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant about this...the packaging kind of reminded me of something my grammy would have. It was on sale, so I purchased it. I immediately loved the scent, a soft baby powderish kinda of scent. It smells good. I now use it daily when applying makeup. It's a must have for me and the container goes a long way! I've replaced my expensive brands with this.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Hough

customer_reviews.title: Powder is nice,  applicator poof is scratchy trash
customer_reviews.text: The powder is lovely, clearly worthy of its long-lived popularity. However, the poof is scratchy and cheap feeling, making this less worthy of a spot on my vanity. I'm use something else to get through this container, but I'll keep looking for an ideal loose powder. I would happily pay for a non-plasticky feeling scratchy poof. I wish companies would stop cutting corners on essential aspects of their products. That's how something goes from classic quality stand-by to discount facsimile.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLou

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: Plenty to last a while, and it covered well but the scent got to me...I don't want to smell like my grandma's perfume until I'm ready. I did drop the container into the sink and the insert fell out causing the powder to empty into the sink. Just keep that in mind the insert won't handle a 1-2 ft. fall well. The lid also just pulls off instead of screws off so it's not the most secure. I was unable to use this completely due to the scent but I will keep it in case I run out of the powder I use daily.
customer_reviews.author: maggerz

customer_reviews.title: Contains cancer causing talcum -should not be sold!
customer_reviews.text: The second you open it, it smells like baby power which also contains talcum. Johnson and Johnson recently lost a multi-million dollar class action lawsuit for the use of talcum power in their products-which has been proven to cause cancer. Putting this loose power on your face means you are absolutely breathing in this dangerous powder. You health is not worth the cheap risk for this makeup. They also do not do reruns, probably because they know people will return once they realize the danger of this product. I’m honestly surprised they are even allowed to sell this product!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Setting Powder!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for baking under the eyes! I took the sifter off of mine so that I could have better access to the powder (since they don't skimp on the amount and it's packed very densely), and it's become my go-to for setting my concealer. I still use a different product for setting foundation and preventing shine, but this definitely lives up to the hype for under-eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great powder for light use!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent powder... I got it initially for baking my under eyes but that didn't go so well as I have a lot of fine lines and wrinkles. But I use it as a finishing powder and just apply a light dusting. It works great, is very blurring and lasts all day. The scent is a little much but if you dont use a ton, its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but scent is bad
customer_reviews.text: The scent is really bad. Kinda smells like old lady perfume. Luckily it doesn’t last that long but it is not good. If you very sensitive to smell I might not get this. I have very oily skin and it works well to set but doesn’t keep me matte. I wasn’t expecting it too so I don’t really mind that.
customer_reviews.author: K Loftis

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful perfume smell
customer_reviews.text: There should be a disclaimer or something in the description saying how “perfumy” it is. I’m very sensitive to scents and with the wrapper still on I could smell it. Took it off to open hoping that maybe it was transfer from something else, nope it instantly gave me a migraine. I had to throw it away outside of my house due to how strong the smell was. I’m sure there is probably someone who this is exactly what they are looking for. But I would not have wasted my money had I known that is was scented so strongly
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: What the heck did I buy?
customer_reviews.text: I for some reason wasn’t expecting this to smell like really strong baby powder. Texture is ok, kind of feels waxy. Presentation is terrible. It’s like they got the wrong size for the plastic bit that keeps the powder in the jar and it bubbled up. Plus it’s held down with tape. The little circle tape that you rip off when you start to use the product holding the powder in was partially peeled and the powder was ALL OVER the makeup pad inside. I’m going to smell like a fresh infant after using this. Did I get the right product?
customer_reviews.author: Satoko

customer_reviews.title: Dislike scent, overall decent powder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A very loose powder, not great for uses such as "face baking" as it is a very thin, loose powder. It is a bit too loose for me, as I have to kind of fan it away from my face as I apply it. Overall, a nice setting powder. I am very sensitive to smells, and get headaches pretty easily. This powder does have a heavier scent to it than I would prefer. I am not able to use it for that reason on days that I already have a bit of a headache. I have normal to dry skin, so typically only use this powder once after applying liquid foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Great powder
customer_reviews.text: I read an article of the best 50 products to buy on Amazon for under $10 and this was one of them. It was under $5, so worth the gamble. I have been very pleased with it. I use is daily and it does a great job of taking the shin off my face. It has a light fresh scent, which is very nice. I don't need a lot. I do touch up throughout the day, but not much and I could probably get away with no touch ups. I would buy this again and I will as soon as I run low.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Smells great, look is okay.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on multiple blogger recommendations. Smells great. Doesn’t cause any breakouts or sensitivity. I don’t use the powder puff. I use the a beauty blender as it presses the powder for oil control. However, I am not impressed enough with coverage to keep in my routine. I took it to work for a quick freshen up. Doesn’t present a powdery look.
customer_reviews.author: Vonda H Norris

customer_reviews.title: Came poorly packaged
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviewers, my product came with the plastic wrap partially ripped off and only covering half the container. Inside had power all over the protective film and it is a little warped. The powder does have a smell, but I can no longer smell it once it is on my face. The color is great, really smooths out skin tone. Although, I find that if I touch my face during the day, some of the powder comes off and I can see some color on my fingers (sometimes it even transfers to my darker clothes if I touch those). Really helps with shine and oily skin!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Don’t sleep on this!
customer_reviews.text: This powder is AMAZING! My grandma used this and I totally forgot about it until seeing it mentioned on Buzzfeed. This powder keeps me matte and shine free all day. The scent is prominent when first applying, but fades quickly. Normally scents bother me, but this does not. You need this powder.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Actually worked for me
customer_reviews.text: For once a powder actually kept the oil rig that is my face at bay. Normally by the afternoon my face is super oily even without makeup but this time it wasn't which is kinda surprising. The products lid was cracked a little on the inside of it and some of the product leaked out from under the sticker that seals it in until you open it. Other than that it's great. I also didn't have to apply alot of the powder, a little went a long way for me. I can't wait to see how it looks at the end of a day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Lunair

customer_reviews.title: Annoying fragrance but Beautiful Results
customer_reviews.text: I used this product back in my younger years and decided to try it again because my sister and I loved it. This is honestly one of the best loose powders I've ever used, EXCEPT for the smell. I don't know what fragrance bomb they are adding to it bit they really should consider "LEAVING IT OUT". Granted, it isn't the greatest smell when applying, but dissipates rather quickly and the flawless finish is left behind. So yes, I will live with the annoying fragrance because I love the results.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: In my skin color looks like white baby powder.
customer_reviews.text: It really works, but to me doesnt look good. Maybe because I chose the wrong one. My skin is Kinda borwn color, and its looks like I have a white baby powder in my face. So this is not good for my skin color maybe I should try another one that is better for me. About the smell, its true the fact that is a strong smell, but it smells good! And when you take off the powder excess it doesnt smell at all. So, dont worry about that. If you really want to try it on go ahead! Its afforable and its a trend.
customer_reviews.author: Perlita C

customer_reviews.title: Stopped using made me more pale and irritated eyes
customer_reviews.text: Got in my eyes a lot when using as a bake and wearing contacts it got under my contacts and caused a lot of discomfort. Also burned my eyes so much I stopped using. The scent really isnt bad it reminds me if a fancy womans scent. I stopped using bc it made me feel cakey and the translucent is so light and doesn't fully brush off that it made me appear paler. Made my foundation stick better and not wipe off on clothes my favorite part was that it made my foundation not as greasy and just soft to the touch on my face
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. I saw so many great reviews and couldn't wait to try it. The texture is great and the smell isn't that horrible. I have very oily skin and up until I used this I had finally figured a good combination of products that lasted most of the day without causing my skin to get oily. The first day I brushed it off as new powder but after a week I am still oily within a couple hours of using it. Next, translucent should not have any color to it. When applied it gave my face a pale look. I will go back to using Elf or NYX brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Crusan

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the scent at all
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the scent at all;itcovers well and is slightly deeper than I expected color wise. The first ingredient listed on pkg. is talc so I try not to breathe in the powder after all the latest talc horror stories. It's such a very old company that makes it; I really don't see their products around much so I had to try it. I use it and yet not everyday. Can you make it paler and without that smell? I will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: consumer at large

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Results, Talc
customer_reviews.text: This item is a miracle in a moderate-sized container. I was absolutely blown away at what it did for my skin. It instantly covered my lines and pores as well as covered almost all imperfections. I was so amazed I had my mom try it who is 50 and has terrible pores all over her face. This product instantly covered them all. She was planning on getting plastic surgery in the future for her pores, but now she doesn't have to with this mind blowing product. My only concern with this product is that the main ingredient is Talc which may be carcinogenic.
customer_reviews.author: CatLady

customer_reviews.title: Too much perfume
customer_reviews.text: This receives luminous reviews. It is incredibly affordable; a generous quantity nicely presented. Yet I am disappointed with the nagging fragrance, which I can smell once applied and made my skin react with allergic flaking. Definitely not recommended for skin with any sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Look before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Coty AirSpun is the loose powder of your dreams. Although its a little perfume-y (some might find it overbearing), I adore the lingering smell, and it brings fond memories of my mother's makeup drawer. I removed the annoying sifter and life was better. The down side would be, as soon as I ordered this, my local Walmart started to carry it for around $6. I paid about $12, but there is so much powder, I probably won't run out any time soon. Before purchasing this online, check some of your local drugstores and you might find it cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great powder, bad scent
customer_reviews.text: Product worked extremely well. I usually use dermablend setting powder for my oily skin but decided to try this one out. It didn’t change the color of my foundation or leave any white cast. It helped my foundation last all day even in this summer heat! When oily eventually seeped through my makeup still looked great, no separation or creasing. Only downside is the scent. It was an old lady perfume type scent that was horrid. Even after blending it and using setting spray I couldn’t smell it on my face! After 20ish minutes it went away but it’s not a pleasant smell. Other than that, this power is great. Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: sarah appelbaum

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I can smell it on my face throughout the ...
customer_reviews.text: This powder works really well. I specifically use it for baking my face, and learned that you can't leave it on for too long or else it will be a bit cakey. That's not much of a dealbreaker considering the drugstore cost, however it does have a strong smell of an older woman's perfume. I feel like I can smell it on my face throughout the day which turns me off from repurchasing it. I may try the unsecented one althought it is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: simone

customer_reviews.title: SMELLS LIKE PERFUME
customer_reviews.text: I like the color of the power but when I opened it today, there was NO security seal and the powder dumped everywhere. A very strong odor of perfume. I am sure the powder is fine but the lack of a security seal made it difficult to even use. It made a huge mess. I will try and use it or donate it, but I will probably not purchase it again. I hope other customers demand safety seals on their products. I did use it today and it was easy to apply and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Cardwell

customer_reviews.title: If you are sensitive to perfumes/fragrance, it's a NO.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems fine. It's like any other translucent loose powder I've tried around the same price range. But the FRAGRANCE. 😔 It smells SO strong and perfumey. I cannot handle the smell. It's not even a nice smell. It's like a grandma's perfume. It made me afraid to use too much for fear of breaking out or getting it in my eyes. After I did my makeup, my husband could smell it when I got into the car with him. Nope. Definitely not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Alysia Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking (setting concealer) as well as sweat prevention!
customer_reviews.text: Great for baking (setting) under eye concealer (or concealer anywhere). Also, if I start sweating during my foundation application, I lightly dust this powder on my skin and the sweating not only stops then, but it will pretty much keep it at bay for the rest of the day. The powder does have a slight scent to it which doesn’t bother me however no one has told me that I smell like something different or powdery since I’ve been wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: jillianmaxmillian

customer_reviews.title: Love love love love love this!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a staple in my makeup routine for over a year now, and I love it! The translucent extra coverage powder has a slight peach tone to it, which is perfect for me. I typically set my foundation with a translucent powder all over the face, and then get this on a brush to wipe off all the excess translucent powder. I find that this keeps any white cast at bay and makes the foundation have a more natural look to it. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying setting powders to find one I love and I just don't like this one. For me, it left my face a whole new tone lighter than before applying and seemed to take off (or modify) the minuscule amount of makeup I wear underneath a setting powder. Also, this REALLY smells like baby powder. Not a preference of mine, so I only used it once or twice and I just couldn't handle that smell on my face, aside from it not doing it's job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

product_meta.title: Coty Airspun Loose Face Powder 2.3 oz. Translucent Tone Loose Face Powder, for Setting Makeup or as Foundation, Lightweight, Long Lasting,Pack of 1
product_meta.description: Color:Translucent| Size:Pack of 1| Style:Face PowderA Beauty Secret since 1935. The creation of a visionary Master Perfumer, Francois Coty, Airspun is a loose face powder blended with air, providing the ultimate in coverage with a lightweight feel. Today it is a must have for highlighting and contouring. Light as air and yet velvety soft, Airspun powder provides a truly flawless finish. Airspun is packaged in a unique round canister with a powder puff applicator. Featuring an exclusive microspun formula where loose powder particles are spun and swirled until they reach a cloud like softness. This ultra smooth powder hides tiny lines, winkles and blemishes and gives a new softness to your skin. Can be used to set makeup or as a foundation. Translucent loose face powder will hide tiny lines, wrinkles and blemishes. Regulates oil control and gives a magnifying look.
feature_bullets: Hide lines & wrinkles: Coty Airspun Face Powder in a Translucent Tone is a loose face and setting powder that helps to minimizes the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles, acne, bumps, scars & other blemishes, giving your facial skin a smoother, softer look

Foundation or setting powder: Coty Airspun Face Powder can be used to help smooth & soften the appearance of your skin as a foundation coverage, or use the loose powder on top of your makeup as a setting powder so you can get that flawless, smooth look

Lightweight long lasting coverage: Airspun Loose Face Powder is long lasting & helps give full coverage that feels lightweight enough to wear all day. This face powder can be used as foundation or setting powder & helps your face look smooth & flawless

Flawless finish: Get the flawless finish you want with the help of Airspun Loose Face Powder. Use to set contouring and highlights, or to help conceal and reduce the look of rough skin, fine lines, wrinkles, skin blemishes & help correct uneven skin tones

Unique airspun face powder: Compare to loose face powder, powder foundation & setting powder from other brands such as Maybelline, NYC, L'Oréal, Milani, Sacha, Revlon, Covergirl, elf., Mehron, bareMinerals, Neutrogena, Rimmel, Clinique & Dermablend

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
